text: Bottle from Ciderwinkel, large sample. Clear orange color, short frothy head. Aroma of sweet apple, bit skunky, some apple pie. Taste of sweet mashed apples, slight spicy apple pie note to it, but mostly just apples. Boring and not complex enough if you ask me. Least of the bunch in a small cider tasting this evening.

Bottle 0.75l at Johnny Off License Roma Italy. 03.12.2015.Thank you Alberto for amazing journey.Taste with Mortlach, ippopotamo36, John, Trevor and cika Boban. Pour it clear golden color with small white head.Aroma peppery and sweet apples.Taste perfect carbonation, like prosseco really, sweet apple juice, some peppery note again just a pinch, smooth delicate finish.Really refreshing.

Bottle courtesy of John Nolan at Johnny Off L. in Rome-Italy. Thank you. Pours a amber-golden color, clear and shining in the glass. Some bubbling on the surface. Nose is a little vinous, cellar notes, apples skin. Mouth is not a blast of sweetness, more balanced. Green apple, complex cider. Impossible not to drink it all. A real gem!

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
Pours a clear golden yellow. Aroma is apples, slight vinegar, vinous, green grapes and a hint of sugary water. Taste is sweet grapes, whitewine, poached pear dessert - sweet but not cloying.

Solid, clear golden with a tight bubbly head. Nose is oily, sulphury washed red chopped apple. Thick set mouthfeel, but a fairly spriteful carbonation. Finishes lean, solid display of the ABV whilst being a simple enough sweep of quenching apple. Bottle, Cheers Steve, Beers I Hadnt Known Tasting
Bottle thanks to Steve. Golden with white head. Aroma of apple pie. Taste of apple pie, green apple. Refreshing. Nice
Bottle at craigs. Pours pale golden, nose is nose is tart apple, taste is juicy fruit, light sweetness.
bottle at home .. Steve tasting ... golden amber ... thin white lacing ... soft dry apple ... soft sweet apple .. light dry tanin linger ... soft sweet fruity apple .. decent

Bottle at Craigs. Pours clear gold with no head. Aromas of fresh apples. Taste is dry, crisp apple skin, juice. Sweet finish. 

12th July Garvie tasting

750 no bottle from Drinkstore. Hazy pale gold, thin white head around the edges of the glass. Nose is green apple skins, a little sour/tartness and a touch of bready yeast. Pretty complex in flavour, fizzy and tart first, some juicy sweetness in the middle, then dries out toward the finish. Liquid coats the mouth and the acidity lingers on the breath. Really finely balanced between dry and sweet. Decent body for a cider, carbonation right up at champagne levels. Really drinkable, gorgeous stuff.

bottle shared at #EBBC14 from drinkstore
clear mid amber, fruity, rich, sweet, smooth, complex apple flavours, dry and tannic yet sweet and fruity. Fantastic, highly recommended.
